It is characterized by its segmented stems and small, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes. Pinalia articulata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to nutrient cycling.
